title: Patient Challenges Your Fee
summary: A patient compares your fees to a cheaper clinic. Communicate value calmly; don't compete on price—invite questions and represent the practice well.

scene.setting: A patient compares your fees to a cheaper clinic. You may feel insecure or annoyed; the hidden risk is defending aggressively and hurting value perception. The decision point is compete on price vs communicate value.

beats.narration: The comparison is on the table. The decision point is match price or explain value calmly.

dialogue.speaker: doc
dialogue.line: I'm glad you're asking. Here's what's different about our approach and what you can expect. What matters most to you?

choices.label: Match the competitor price to keep the patient.

steps.step: When value is clearly different: explain first; when to hold on price; consistent policy.

leader_lines: Matching price can undermine value. Let me explain what's different—then you can choose.
When do we hold on price?
scripts.closing_line: Explain value; they choose; consistent policy.

choices.label: Explain quality and experience differences calmly; invite questions.

steps.step: Explain differences calmly; invite questions; no pressure.
One training or script: key differentiators, what we don't cut corners on.

leader_lines: Here's what's different about our quality and experience. What questions do you have?
Value must be communicated, not defended.
questions: How do we train staff on value communication?
scripts.closing_line: Key differentiators; scripting; what we don't cut corners on.

choices.label: Dismiss their concern and say they can go elsewhere.

steps.step: Acknowledge then explain your value; offer to discuss what matters to them; no pressure, clear choice.

leader_lines: I don't want you to feel dismissed. What matters to you—I can explain how we fit that.
How do we respond when they compare?

choices.label: Offer a one-time discount to show flexibility.

steps.step: Clear one-time framing; value conversation first; documented and consistent policy.

leader_lines: If we do something on price, it's one time—and I still want you to know why our care is worth it.
scripts.closing_line: One-time framing; value conversation first; documented policy.

system_prompts.nudge: Value must be communicated, not defended.
system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you compete on price or communicate value?

outcomes.message: Relationship may be damaged. Opportunity to communicate value was lost.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with communicate-value?
How do you respond when they compare?

outcomes.message: You've represented the practice well. Patient may stay or leave with clear understanding of value.
reflection_questions: How do you train staff on value?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I communicated value without defending. (1-5)
